intro: Paractaenum novae-hollandiae subsp. reversum, commonly known as the reverse-flowered paractaenum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology. The subspecies is notable for its unique arrangement of floral parts, which sets it apart from other members of the species. It typically grows in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, thriving in nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a bilaterally symmetrical structure.
